numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The percentage of young women who reach out to their parents is higher than the percentage of young men who reach out to their parents.
2. For text messages, the difference is large.
3. For phone chats, the difference is large.
4. For video chats, the difference is large.
5. For text messages and phone chats and video chats, the difference is more than 20 percentage points.
6. For in-person visits, the difference between young men and young women is smaller.
7. For in-person visits, the percentage of young women who reach out to their parents is higher than the percentage of young men who reach out to their parents.
8. For in-person visits, the difference is about 5 percentage points.
9. I wonder why this phenomenon occurs.
10. There is a reason why fewer young men reach out to their parents than young women.
11. I want to know this reason.
12. Some factors influence this phenomenon.
13. I want to know these factors.
14. Girls are raised in a certain way.
15. Boys are raised in a certain way.
16. Girls are socialized in a certain way.
17. Boys are socialized in a certain way.
18. This difference in raising and socializing may cause this phenomenon.
19. This phenomenon relates to me.
20. This phenomenon relates to my community.
21. I am in the age range that this graphic examines.
22. Nearly everyone that I am surrounded with on a regular basis is in the age range that this graphic examines.
23. I no longer live with my parents.
24. My relationship with my parents is changing.
25. This change is interesting to me.
26. I have become more aware of how much I talk to my parents.
27. I want to know what types of communication are common in my age range.
28. This knowledge is interesting to me.
29. The title is: How Adulthood Changes Communication in Parent-Child Relationships.
